reviews.sentence: The bed was very confortable. I did not like the staff from the front desk and room service. The windows were very dirty for this time of year. The food menu listed descriptions that did not match the order like whole grain bread and instead I got plain white wonder bread. Expensive.

do not use for an event. We were there for a conference. The hotel property was adequate. It is located conveniently to the DVP so it is easy to get to. However there is really nothing near it. If you are in Toronto for leisure you do not want to be here. But really the biggest mark against it from a service level they were totally unprepared to handle our conference needs. Coffee stations inadequately serviced during our scheduled breaks. An inordinately long time for food service at our gala. A dismissive attitude when one of our table mates indicated that they had a severe allergy. A bar with only one bartender scheduled for a two hour break in our program they knew our timing. The bar on our last night there closing at midnight basically losing our on thousands of dollars in business. We also had issues with the billing of our rooms but that was more to do with Westin corporate rather than the the hotel itself. On a positive note the front desk staff were excellent the room was clean the park like setting was very nice and the lobby beautiful. But given their issues with our event and the fact that there really is not anything exciting around it I would not recommend this hotel.

I think they were trying to hurry us out. I recently attended a business dinner here in one of the meeting rooms. I had never been to this location before and at first glance the outside of the building is quite dated. I was surprised when I entered the lobby as the decor was quite modern. Our dinner meeting was held in the meeting area located several floors below. As our meeting included a presentation the dinner was buffet style served before to be consumed during the presentation. The buffet layout was as follows Cutlery followed by chopped lettuce croutons and dressing a mixed salad with cucumbers tomatoes and onions followed by what seemed to be a pasta dish with mixed vegetables a breaded chicken cutlet dish salmon with a tomato sauce accompanied by standard white bread rolls and for dessert individual canoli mini tiramisu and macarons. It would have been nice to have labels on the dinner menu items to know exactly what was being served. Additionally as we consumed our dinner the server repeatedly asked us for coffee tea during the meal and if we said no at that point she removed our cups. The other server was quite attentive in replenishing our drinks for the initial part of the evening however after the presentation had started and we had begun our meals our servers did not come by to replenish our wine beverages or clear our dishes. Although it was a buffet style dinner once the presentation had begun approximately 30 mins into the meal the servers began clearing the buffet table so that individuals could not go back to the table if they wanted to. They also began clearing the unused tables of lines chairs and cutlery while we were still there. Furthermore even before we were finished dinner they removed our platesThe food was bland and mediocre at best as was the service. Overall I would not recommend the facilities given my experience although I have not stayed overnight in the hotel.

do not Stay Here. We recently stood here for a 3 night stay here with my family and when we arrived the front desk person was very helpful. After we checked in we went to our room and as I put my bag down by the TV I saw the nastiest bug on the floor. The bug was the size of a half dollar. The maintenance guy who was extremely nice came and flushed it down the toilet. He called front desk and told them to give us another room. which i thought was extremely nice on his part. We got a new room on the 4th floor. The next morning we woke up and the floor smelled like chemicals. For the past three days that we were here the stench of chemicals or whatever it was did not go away. We did not even eat at the hotel because we found that bug in our room. Overall I would never stay here again. The only thing nice about this hotel is the lobby and that s it.

Good location for driving access to North York. I stayed in a traditional room now I know that means un renovated. The room was pretty dated carpet and furniture was worn and a few small stains. However bed was heavenly and shower was good so I did have a good enough stay. Location has quite a few restaurants around for a quick bite walk across a pretty main road and they are all on the side of the road and the grounds are nice. I was surprised to see them charging 12 for overnight parking in the middle of nowhere though. Bottom line it is close to my parents house so I would stay there again but if I were here to see Toronto would definitely pick a nicer hotel in a nicer location. Though if you can not afford that the Prince will do nicely.

dated hotel and hit and miss hotel staff. Checked in for 2 nights and had a very rude woman at reception. She was more interested in checking her nail polish. I am a SPG member and I was given a room on the 3rd floor. It took ages to get there and then it was in a dark little corner of the hotel beside the exit stairs. The room smelled like they were trying to cover up the fact that someone had been smoking in the room. I went back to the front desk to complain and get a different room and had a very nice gentleman who was very apologetic and gave me a room on the 20th floor. Room was similar to the other not in the corner by the stairs and. no smoke smell. A knock came on the door about a half hour later and room service brought me an apple orange banana and 2 strawberries on a plate with 2 bottles of water. Note there was no water in my room as there should of been. It was the hotels way of apologizing for giving me a smoky room at the very back of the hotel when I checked in which should of never happened in the first place. What ever happened to the days of a fruit and cheese basket and a bottle of wine. Now that would of been a much better apology. The rooms are not sound proof and you can hear everyone in the hallways. My TV did not function properly and I had to have their repair man up to the room to fix it. The same problem happened the second day but having seen the repair man fix it the day before I did the same thing he did and it started to work again. The bed was comfortable. They charge 120 a day to park your car outdoors. Room service was prompt. The food was so so. An advertised ground chuck hamburger in their menu was actually a frozen processed piece of meat. Note to hotel restaurant manager. if you advertise ground chuck it should be ground chuck. The hallways are super dull and dark. Air conditioning was extremely noisy when starting and stopping. It almost sounded like someone was entering the room. Cleaning of room was not thorough. Lots of restaurants nearby walking andor a few minutes by car. Stayed here as I had meetings with companies near by. I will find another hotel the next time I need to come to meet these clients. Overall was not impressed. Except for the gentleman who changed my room the other hotel staff were rather unfriendly.

Apathetic Front Desk. I stayed here for a wedding which was to take place in the hotels banquet hall. A wedding in which was the best man. I arranged for an early check in and arrived at 12 pm tuxedo garment bag in hand. I was told that no room would be available until 3 pm. I explained that I was due for bridal party pictures at 130pm. Front desk staff member Cynthia said well that is not my problem. I do not have a room for you. Interestingly the manager was able to produce a room within 20mins and also offered me access to the health club to get showered shaved and dressed. Cynthia your manager Jenny needs to discuss appropriate ways of communicating with customers. When you work in service your job is to make your customers problems YOUR PROBLEM. Anything else is not exceptional service. This is not the DMV it is the Westin Prince. A good customer service rep would always brainstorm options and put themselves in the customers shoes. it is not my problem and interrupting an anxious customer are horrible ways to represent the hotel and the brand. Otherwise the hotel could just put an iPad there for customers to check themselves in. That would save the hotel your salary. So realize that you are there for the human experience. Be a human next time or more people will write reviews like this about you and the brand you represent.

Overnight stay. We recently spent the night while attending a wedding. We arrived at 430 and our room was not ready. We were offered a another room but it did not meet our needs. Eventually were given the room type we requested with just minutes to get ready. The room was very tired looking and the waste baskets had not been emptied. The hotel does have lovely grounds.

Located with lots of nearby dining and grocery options. Westin Prince Toronto Hotel is conveniently located to a lot of different takeaway and eat in restaurants. No need to eat in the hotel if you want to save a few bucks. There is a large Korean supermarket across the street behind the restaurants. About 750 metres to the right there is a Longos supermarket that is quite nice right beside the good sized LCBO provincial liquor storeWe had a small refrigerator bar fridge can not be emptied unles you want to pay for the contents and microwave brought up to our room which was very useful in our six night stay. Never did get the temperature on the fridge to do other than freeze things. We also had a multi media device hooked up to our TV which enabled watching Netflix etc from laptop. All three items were complimentary. The room was roomy and the king bed comfy. I really enjoyed the microfibre dressing gown provided. Housekeeping was a bit hit or miss but when we called down to Service Express for anything it usually arrived promptly. The room lacked a normal hotel introduction package with location of ice machines TV channel listings restaurant hours etc. asked at the front desk and was told these were not provided any more. Shortly after midnight on the departure night we discovered the disadvantage of having a room with an door that adjoins it to another. After having an excess delay to get a key card reprogramed we were given two complimentary breakfast buffet vouchers value 25 each. Breakfast was OK but could have been better. The gym was somewhat cramped and being summer got over run by kids. The pool is not big enough to do laps and was also full of kids. Did not try the hot tub. There is a tennis court and basket ball hoop. Overall a nice hotel and a pleasant stay. If in this part of Toronto would stay here again.

Budget Westin. slow elevators food service small rooms. I stayed here for one night a few weekends ago as part of some corporate meetings we were running at The Westin Prince. This is my lease favourite Westin stay located in north Toronto you need a car and quite dated despite renovations. My room was small the elevators were very slow up to 10 minute wait and our Duncan meeting room had a loud disruptive ventilation system. I ordered a soup and it took almost an hour to be delivered definitely not up to my usual Westin standards. Only average at best.

Very nice stay. I stayed here for 3 nights for a conference in the area. The hotel itself exceeded my expectations. It was a very nice clean hotel with great dining options. My room was clean the bathroom was clean and the staff was very helpful throughout. It was about a 20 minute drive into downtown. I had an incident where I burned my finger. While the staff was very helpful in getting me ice it would be nice for the hotel to carry some basic first aid supplies for a small incident like mine. That would be my only recommendation. Other than that great hotel.

Warm and Welcoming. I live in San Francisco but perform a lot of work in the Toronto area both downtown and Richmond Hill NE suburban. The Westin Prince is the nicest facility located reasonably in between. I stayed there almost every week from Sept thru April and was quite comfortable. I am pleased to report that the same standards are being upheld six months later. The rooms are inviting and the quality of sleep on the bedding is outstanding. The bar is warm and welcoming on a cold Ontario night and the food is easily 4 star quality if expensive in bot the bar and the restaurant.

Fabulous. Some hotels I have stayed in could learn from this hotel. They recycle everything and it is located in the room reminding guests that it is a good thing to recycle. Yay. Staff was super warm and friendly and happy. Room was clean very comfortable and lovely. Thank you.

Very friendly and helpful staff great experience. We traveled from the US to Toronto back in October 2016. We stayed in this hotel for 2 night and had a great experience mainly because the staff were very pleasant and helpful. Paul Lee at front desk kindly helped us recover our mistakenly canceled reservation. We had a long day of traveling and it was nice that he fixed the problem for us without anyhasles. The hotel is also located conveniently near restaurants and shops walking distance. I highly recommend.

i stayed with you guys this month 2 weeks back. Best stay ever best breakfast stay and service loved every minute of it special thumbs up to the conceirge Leroy was so helpful and another gentleman named Milan i think i ca nt remember who was there during the evening shift was super helpful and kind. Thank you for making it the most memorable stay for me ever. Ca nt wait to be back �.

Clean and Comfortable. Hotel is beautiful and spacious. Rooms are decent size and nicely decorated. We were they Dec 9 2016. It was a very busy Friday night with lots of guests and holiday parties going on. The line up to get checked into was quite long as there were only 2 customer service people working the check in counter. But they were very efficient and friendly. I would definitely stay there again.
Top shelf service. Fantastic. Top rate service. Would stay again and again.
Went for a couple hours for a work party professional atmosphere. A lot of parking very classy and stylish.

The hotel was shabby the carpets in our room were dirty and loose easy to slip on. All round it is in dire need of renovation. Also the food in the restaurant was poor. The toasted cheese we ordered in our room was just 2 slices of toast with 2 slices of cheese at an astronomical price. All in all we would never stay there again.

Comfortable but dated. We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights. On arrival they asked me for my credit card and charged me far more than I was quoted. On questioning they said that it was in anticipation of what we may have spent after 4 days. I have never experienced that before. The hotel has a beautiful lobby. The rooms are large but very dated. The beds were comfortable yet the place seems to need a good cleaning. Carpets need to be steam cleaned or replaced. The bathroom was modernized. The thing that struck me as strange is that they charged me for a small jug of milk which I requested once for our coffee tea. We came for a wedding and there were 4 families who stayed at this hotel for the same wedding yet they refused to give us a better rate despite the fact that the wedding brunch was held at this hotel. The staff were pleasant especially the cleaning staff. It is an environmentally friendly hotel.
Good service well laid out.

Good base for Toronto. Spent seven nights here and enjoyed it. Not quite sure if it lives up to the Westin branding though. The bed was comfortable but the sheets sometimes were heavenly and other times rough. Same with the towels. The room was very large but was missing the basics. a mini fridge for drinks a safe for passports. even though the hotel indicated that this would be there. There were places for these things. they just were not there. The late night room service menu was very basic which was shocking for a hotel of this size. The location was very good for touring the city. On the worst day during rush hour it took about 40 minutes to get from Rogers Center to the hotel. Getting out of the hotel can be tricky if traffic is bad especially if turning left. There are lots of great small restaurants in the area. Overall it was a good stay but there is room for improvement. SIDE NOTE. I am surprised that this hotel does not offer a shuttle for the local area.

Very pleasant hotel with fantastic food. The easy check in nice clean room. Very reasonable price included breakfast. Excellent restaurant service and very tasty and well presented food. Polish waiter was very nice and helpful. We absolutely would recommend this hotel when stay in Toronto.

Great Hotel. After reading reviews we were unsure on arrival of what to expect. The hotel entrance and lobby is exceptional check in was easy and our room was available early. Our room was clean and comfortable we are a family of 4 and there were 2 double beds a large tv side unit and 2 chairs in the room. We also asked for a fridge which was brought to our room immediately. The outdoor pool area was clean and well maintained with a tennis court beside. We did not eat in the hotel so could not comment on food. Directly across the road were a number of restaurants including an Italian Popeyes chicken Pizza Hut Tim Hortons and a lovely Pub which serve the best Nachos 20 mins drive took you downtown also 20 mins to Canada Wonderland and Outlet stores. If we return to Toronto we would be happy to stay in The Westin again.

I enjoyed my stay. I liked the location the proximity to every where you need to go in North York. I liked the cleanliness of the room and the hotel in general and that they have outdoor pool which we really enjoyed. The restaurant also have an excellent variety of food. I wish they have a minibar or mini fridge in the room. It was a disappointment that they do not. Although they do have dry cleaning service but it would be nice if they have a coin operated washer and dryer on the site.
Staff was nice hotel was clean and parking on site was easy.

Have visited this hotel many times. What was once a great neighbourhood hotel is now under new management and the vibe of the place is very different. I am an elite SPG Mariot member and the rooms that I got was certainly not upgraded. Last time I stayed there I was given a room with stains on the floor the faucet in the room came out as soon as I attempted to open the water and the room decor was outdated. Not exactly what you expect from a Westin. The front desk seemed like they did not know what to do I had to come back later to speak to a manager and get a new room. They have stopped serving food by their pool which I ca n’t understand. I wanted to relax there for the day and could not because we needed to be dressed and go upstairs to have lunch. What was once an iconic 70 ’s architecture is now getting ruined as the owners do n’t seem to care. The nicest parts of the hotel are it ’s meeting rooms and the Sunday brunch is fantastic on holidays like Father ’s Day.

Excellent value for the cost. Very nice decor. Shower not working properly. The room 465 was spacious the bed very comfortable and I loved the reading light. would you give me the name of the brand and suplierHowever for a newly renovated hotel room the bathroom was disappointing. The toilet should have been comfort height. Young and older people prefer that nowadays. The shower assembly is poor. The controls were so hard to operate it took me about five minutes to get the water to flow and even then the pressure was minimal. Not godFinaly please put a channel guide for the TV on the dresser. See above.

Adequate. Westin is a name I have always trusted. But they really let me down this time. For a 5 night stay in Toronto I have had to move to 3 different rooms. First room had a mystery noise in the hallway all night long a loud bang every 30 to 40 minutes that no one could figure out. This went on for two nights before I had to move. Room 2 had a clogged shower drain. I reported the problem but nothing happened. Next day in that room the shower backed up again and I had to stop halfway through or risk turning the entire bathroom floor into a lake. Apparently the drainage problems are so bad maintenance told me I had better move to room 3. These are pretty major problems from my perspective yet I only got a cursory sorry from the hotel staff and no offer to discount or offer increased points or any other form of compensation for the major inconvenience. Overall the staff is competent but there is no sense of extra mile service. They just maintain the status quo. On the plus side the restaurant is quite pleasant and the wait staff nice. The biggest saving grace is a huge forested park at the back of the property with a couple of lovely trails and a large grenspace with chairs and hammocks. Overall the place is adequate and fine for a weekend stay. But for me a week was just too much.

I hosted a guest from out of country and she was very satisfied with the care that she received. The greeting we received from the staff at the front desk was pleasant professional and informed. The internet was easy to connect to. The room was spacious and clean and soothing. It was especially nice that the bathroom had a tub not just a shower stall.
